titleStmt.title: Strength out of weakness. Or A glorious manifestation of the further progresse of the gospel amongst the Indians in New-England. Held forth in sundry letters from divers ministers and others to the corporation established by Parliament for promoting the gospel among the heathen in New-England; and to particular members thereof since the last treatise to that effect, / formerly set forth by Mr Henry Whitfield late pastor of Gilford in New-England. ; Published by the aforesaid corporation.
titleStmt.author: Gouge, William, 1578-1653.
Whitfield, Henry, 1597-1660?
Eliot, John, 1604-1690.
Wilson, John, 1588-1667.
Leverich, William, d. 1677.
Bessey, Anthony, 1609?-1657?
Mayhew, Thomas, 1621-1657.
Endecott, John, 1588?-1665.
French, William, 1603?-1681.
Allen, Thomas, 1608-1673.
Society for Propagation of the Gospel in New England.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by M. Simmons for John Blague and Samuel Howes, and are to be sold at their shop in Popes Head Alley.,

notesStmt.note: The dedication is signed: William Steele, president.
"To the reader" is signed by W. Gouge and thirteeen others.
Includes letters from John Eliot, John Wilson, William Leverich, Anthony Bessey, Thomas Mayhew, John Endecott, William French, and Thomas Allen.
Reproduction of original in the John Carter Brown Library.

place.placeName: their shop in Popes Head Alley.
